definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
the young will be redoubtable in the years to come (idiom)/the younger generations will surpass us in time

sentences.english: Dominion and fear are with him, he maketh peace in his high places.
sentences.chinese: 神有治理之權，威嚴可畏，他在高天之處施行和平。

sentences.english: Who is like you-majestic in holiness, awesome in glory, working wonders?
sentences.chinese: 誰能象你至聖至榮，可頌可畏，施行奇事？

sentences.english: Say to God, 'How awesome are your deeds!
sentences.chinese: 當對神說，你的作爲何等可畏。

sentences.english: Do you see the great reversal here?
sentences.chinese: 看見這裏神大而可畏的翻轉了麼？

sentences.english: Knowing therefore the fear of the Lord, we persuade men
sentences.chinese: 我們既知道主是可畏的，所以勸人。

sentences.english: A fearful thing, the need to identify more different.
sentences.chinese: 人言可畏，人言更需要鑑別。

sentences.english: The eye of the Lord may be fearsome, but we who trust in Him rejoice.
sentences.chinese: 上帝的眼目固然可畏，但信靠他的人可以歡然喜樂。

definition: that being the case/then/in that case
